notes:
1. Concept

Future Worth (FW) or Future Value (FV) is the value of an asset or cash flow at a specified date in the future that is equivalent in value to a specified sum today.

2. Key Factors

  • (F/P, i, n) - Single Payment Compound Amount Factor: Finds the future value ($F$) of a single present sum ($P$). $$ F = P(1+i)^n $$
  • (F/A, i, n) - Uniform Series Compound Amount Factor: Finds the future value ($F$) of an annuity ($A$). This is used to calculate the accumulated value of a series of savings deposits. $$ F = A \left[ \frac{(1+i)^n - 1}{i} \right] $$

solvedExamples.question: If you deposit $2,000 annually into an account paying 6% interest, how much will be in the account immediately after the 5th deposit? (F/A, 6%, 5) = 5.6371
solvedExamples.explanation: We need the future worth of a uniform series. $F = A(F/A, 6\%, 5) = 2,000(5.6371) = 11,274.20$.

solvedExamples.question: What is the future worth of $5,000 invested today for 10 years at 8% interest compounded annually? (F/P, 8%, 10) = 2.1589
solvedExamples.explanation: Use the single payment compound amount factor. $F = P(F/P, 8\%, 10) = 5,000(2.1589) = 10,794.50$.
